content.description: In the figure above, line L is tangent to the graph of y = <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaaWdaeaapeGaamiEa8aadaahaaWcbeqa a8qacaaIYaaaaaaaaaa@3924@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> at point P, with coordinatesÂ <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>w</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>w</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaqadaWdaeaapeGaam4DaiaacYcadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaaGymaaWd aeaapeGaam4Da8aadaahaaWcbeqaa8qacaaIYaaaaaaaaOGaayjkai aawMcaaaaa@3C81@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, where w > 0. Point Q has coordinates (w, 0). Line L crosses the x-axis at point R, with coordinates (k, 0).
content.question: For all w > 0, find k in terms of w.

frqParts.text: For all w > 0, find k in terms of w.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
